title: 110_hr938
content: The "Nuclear Family Priority Act" changes preference allocation for spouses and children of permanent resident aliens and amends the worldwide level of family-sponsored immigrants. The Immigration and Nationality Act is amended to allocate 75 percent of family-sponsored immigrant visas without regard to per country limitations. The remaining 25 percent is available for countries subject to specific conditions. The Immigration and Nationality Act is amended to allocate family-sponsored immigrant visas without per country limitations. 77 percent of visas can be issued to natives of a foreign state or area, with specific conditions for the remaining 23 percent. The Immigration and Nationality Act is amended to update rules for determining if certain aliens are children and the procedure for granting immigrant status. The Immigration and Nationality Act is amended to update rules for determining if certain aliens are children and the procedure for granting immigrant status, including changes to preference status, waivers of inadmissibility, and conditional permanent resident status for alien spouses and children. The Immigration and Nationality Act is amended to update rules for determining if certain aliens are children and the procedure for granting immigrant status, including changes to preference status, waivers of inadmissibility, and conditional permanent resident status for alien spouses and children. Amendments include striking specific references and inserting updated ones in relevant sections. The amendments made by this Act will take effect on the first day of the second fiscal year after enactment, invalidating certain petitions and visa applications related to family-sponsored immigrant categories.
